Templates.name: sap.ushell.System
Templates.helpDescription: A representation of a system Constructs a new system object representing a system used in the Unified Shell.

	"${vContainer}", // object|sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.ContentNode|sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.ContentNode[]
	"${sContentProviderId}" // string
)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.addBookmark
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.119 Please use {@link sap.ushell.services.BookmarkV2#addBookmark} instead.
Adds a bookmark tile to one of the user's classic home page groups or to multiple provided content nodes.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.addCatalogTileToGroup
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.112 Please use {@link sap.ushell.services.BookmarkV2#addBookmark} instead.
Adds the catalog tile with the given ID to given group. The catalog tile is looked up in the legacy SAP HANA catalog unless data to look up a remote catalog is provided.

)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.addCustomBookmark
Templates.helpDescription: Adds a custom bookmark visualization to one or multiple provided content nodes.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.countCustomBookmarks
Templates.helpDescription: Counts all custom bookmarks matching exactly the identification data. Can be used to check if a bookmark already exists (e.g. before updating).

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.deleteCustomBookmarks
Templates.helpDescription: Deletes all custom bookmarks matching exactly the identification data. {@link #countCustomBookmarks} can be used to check upfront how many bookmarks are going to be affected.

Templates.template:
updateBookmarks(

	{
		title: "${title}", // string

		icon: "${icon}", // string

		subtitle: "${subtitle}", // string
		serviceUrl: "${serviceUrl}", // string
		dataSource: ${dataSource}, // object
		serviceRefreshInterval: "${serviceRefreshInterval}", // string
		numberUnit: "${numberUnit}" // string
	},
	"${sContentProviderId}" // string
)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.updateBookmarks
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.119 Please use {@link sap.ushell.services.BookmarkV2#updateBookmarks} instead.
Updates all bookmarks pointing to the given URL on all of the user's pages with the given new parameters. Parameters which are omitted are not changed in the existing bookmarks.

	},

		title: "${title}", // string

		icon: "${icon}", // string
		info: "${info}", // string
		vizConfig: ${vizConfig}, // object
		loadManifest: ${bLoadManifest}, // boolean
		chipConfig: ${chipConfig} // object
	}
)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Bookmark.updateCustomBookmarks
Templates.helpDescription: Updates all custom bookmarks matching exactly the identification data. Only given properties are updated. {@link #countCustomBookmarks} can be used to check upfront how many bookmarks are going to be affected. The vizType as well as the chipId of the bookmarks cannot be changed!

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.ContentExtensionAdapterFactory.getAdapters
Templates.helpDescription:
Constructs a new instance of the Content Extension Adapter Factory. An array of adapter configurations needs to be passed to it (one specific adapter for each extended content). The configuration can be passed explicitly as an array vConfig or coded in ContentExtensionAdapterConfig.

Once instantiated, it generates a map of all the needed adapters and returns them (as a promise) with the method #getAdapterMap. Once the Promises resolve, the adapters are available in the map.

IMPORTANT: aConfig.contentProviderName is the string any content would use to indicate the LaunchPage service which adapter needs to be used through a field "contentProvider" e.g. oGroup.contentProvider

Currently, the configuration mocks the content through FeatureGroupConfig and uses the local adapter. This should be changed once a dedicated adapter for the extended content exists.

Templates.template:
getLinks(
	{
		semanticObject: "${semanticObject}", // string
		action: "${action}", // string
		params: ${params}, // object
		withAtLeastOneUsedParam: ${bWithAtLeastOneUsedParam}, // boolean
		sortResultsBy: "${sortResultsBy}", // string
		treatTechHintAsFilter: ${bTreatTechHintAsFilter}, // boolean
		ui5Component: ${ui5Component}, // sap.ui.core.Component
		appStateKey: "${appStateKey}", // string
		compactIntents: ${bCompactIntents}, // boolean
		tags: [${tags}] // string[]
	}
)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation.getLinks
Templates.helpDescription: Resolves the given semantic object (and action) and business parameters to a list of links available to the user.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Extension.createHeaderItem
Templates.helpDescription:
Creates a header item in the shell header. Restrictions:
  • The control properties are only allowed to contain primitive properties and event handlers. Aggregations, controls and types with prototypes are not allowed!
  • The event handlers are not bound to the actual control and do not receive the event arguments.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.Extension.createUserAction
Templates.helpDescription:
Creates a user action in the user action menu.
The controlType can be any control and is by default a {@link sap.ushell.ui.launchpad.ActionItem}. The controlProperties are passed to the constructor of the control.
Restrictions:
  • The control properties are only allowed to contain primitive properties and event handlers. Aggregations, controls and types with prototypes are not allowed!
  • The event handlers are not bound to the actual control and do not receive the event arguments.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.FrameBoundExtension.FloatingContainer.fireDockingStateUpdate
Templates.helpDescription: Fires event {@link #event:dockingStateUpdate dockingStateUpdate} to attached listeners.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.FrameBoundExtension.SidePane.createItem
Templates.helpDescription: Creates an item in the side pane. The controlType can be any control and is by default a {@link sap.m.Button}. The controlProperties are passed to the constructor of the control.

Templates.template:
addGroupedUserSettingsEntry(
	{
		entryHelpID: "${entryHelpID}", // string
		title: "${title}", // string
		value: ${value}, // string|function() : Promise<string>
		content: ${content}, // function() : Promise<sap.ui.core.Control>
		onSave: ${fn_onSave}, // function
		onCancel: ${onCancel}, // function() : Promise
		provideEmptyWrapper: ${bProvideEmptyWrapper}, // boolean
		groupingId: "${groupingId}", // string
		groupingTabTitle: "${groupingTabTitle}", // string
		groupingTabHelpId: "${groupingTabHelpId}" // string
	}
)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.FrameBoundExtension.addGroupedUserSettingsEntry
Templates.helpDescription:
Adds an entry to the user settings dialog box including the UI control that appears when the user clicks the new entry, and handling of user settings actions such as SAVE and CANCEL.

Restriction: NOT available for apps running in an iframe

	}
)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.FrameBoundExtension.addUserSettingsEntry
Templates.helpDescription:
Adds an entry to the user settings dialog box including the UI control that appears when the user clicks the new entry, and handling of user settings actions such as SAVE and CANCEL.

Restriction: NOT available for apps running in an iframe

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.FrameBoundExtension.createFooter
Templates.helpDescription:
Creates a new footer which is positioned below the launchpad content. The controlType can be any control and is by default a {@link sap.m.Bar}. The controlProperties are passed to the constructor of the control.

Note: Only one footer is displayed at once. Any new footer will replace the previous one

Restriction: NOT available for apps running in an iframe

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.FrameBoundExtension.createHeaderItem
Templates.helpDescription: Creates a header item in the shell header.

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.FrameBoundExtension.createSubHeader
Templates.helpDescription:
Creates a new sub header which is positioned below the header. The controlType can be any control and is by default a {@link sap.m.Bar}. The controlProperties are passed to the constructor of the control.

Note: Only one sub header is displayed at once

Restriction: NOT available for apps running in an iframe

Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.FrameBoundExtension.createUserAction
Templates.helpDescription: Creates a user action in the user action menu. The controlType can be any control and is by default a {@link sap.ushell.ui.launchpad.ActionItem}. The controlProperties are passed to the constructor of the control.

Templates.helpDescription: Collects and returns all apps

)
Templates.name: sap.ushell.services.SpaceContent.updateVisualization
Templates.helpDescription: Updates the properties of a visualization. Properties that are not supplied are not updated. Currently only the display format, title and subtitle are supported.

Templates.helpDescription: Creates a Support Ticket. Forwards the given data (JSON object) to the associated adapter.

		tooltip: ${tooltip}, // sap.ui.core.TooltipBase
		customData: [${customData}], // sap.ui.core.CustomData[]
		layoutData: ${layoutData}, // sap.ui.core.LayoutData

Templates.template:
new sap.ushell.ui.footerbar.AddBookmarkButton(
	"${sId}", // string
	{
		id: ${id}, // sap.ui.core.ID
		models: ${models}, // object
		bindingContexts: ${bindingContexts}, // object
		objectBindings: ${objectBindings}, // object
		metadataContexts: ${metadataContexts}, // object
		validationSuccess: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		validationError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		parseError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		formatError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		modelContextChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tooltip: ${tooltip}, // sap.ui.core.TooltipBase
		customData: [${customData}], // sap.ui.core.CustomData[]
		layoutData: ${layoutData}, // sap.ui.core.LayoutData
		dependents: [${dependents}], // sap.ui.core.Element[]
		dragDropConfig: [${dragDropConfig}], // sap.ui.core.dnd.DragDropBase[]
		fieldHelpDisplay: ${fieldHelpDisplay}, // (sap.ui.core.Element|string)
		blocked: ${bBlocked}, // boolean
		busy: ${bBusy}, // boolean
		busyIndicatorDelay: ${1000}, // int
		busyIndicatorSize: ${sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium}, // sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize
		visible: ${bVisible}, // boolean
		fieldGroupIds: [${fieldGroupIds}], // string[]
		validateFieldGroup: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		text: ${""}, // string
		type: ${sap.m.ButtonType.Default}, // sap.m.ButtonType
		width: ${width}, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
		enabled: ${bEnabled}, // boolean
		icon: ${""}, // sap.ui.core.URI
		iconFirst: ${bIconFirst}, // boolean
		activeIcon: ${activeIcon}, // sap.ui.core.URI
		iconDensityAware: ${bIconDensityAware}, // boolean
		textDirection: ${sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit}, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
		ariaHasPopup: ${sap.ui.core.aria.HasPopup.None}, // sap.ui.core.aria.HasPopup
		accessibleRole: ${sap.m.ButtonAccessibleRole.Default}, // sap.m.ButtonAccessibleRole
		highlightAccKeysRef: ${bHighlightAccKeysRef}, // boolean
		accesskey: ${""}, // string
		badgeStyle: ${sap.m.BadgeStyle.Default}, // sap.m.BadgeStyle
		ariaDescribedBy: [${ariaDescribedBy}], // (sap.ui.core.Control|string)[]
		ariaLabelledBy: [${ariaLabelledBy}], // (sap.ui.core.Control|string)[]
		tap: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		press: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		beforePressHandler: ${fn_beforePressHandler}, // function
		afterPressHandler: ${fn_afterPressHandler}, // function
		title: "${title}", // string
		subtitle: "${subtitle}", // string
		info: "${info}", // string
		tileIcon: "${tileIcon}", // string
		numberUnit: "${numberUnit}", // string
		keywords: "${keywords}", // string
		customUrl: ${customUrl}, // any
		serviceUrl: ${serviceUrl}, // any
		dataSource: ${dataSource}, // any
		serviceRefreshInterval: "${serviceRefreshInterval}", // string
		showGroupSelection: ${bShowGroupSelection}, // boolean
		showPageSelection: ${bShowPageSelection}, // boolean
		appData: ${appData} // object
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getBeforePressHandler beforePressHandler} : function
    • {@link #getAfterPressHandler afterPressHandler} : function
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string
    • {@link #getInfo info} : string
    • {@link #getTileIcon tileIcon} : string
    • {@link #getNumberUnit numberUnit} : string
    • {@link #getKeywords keywords} : string
    • {@link #getCustomUrl customUrl} : any
    • {@link #getServiceUrl serviceUrl} : any
    • {@link #getDataSource dataSource} : any
    • {@link #getServiceRefreshInterval serviceRefreshInterval} : string
    • {@link #getShowGroupSelection showGroupSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowPageSelection showPageSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAppData appData} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Button#constructor sap.m.Button} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.ui.footerbar.AddBookmarkButton
Templates.helpDescription: Enables users to save bookmark tiles in the Fiori launchpad. Clicking the button opens a dialog box for saving the app state, so that the app can be launched directly in that state from the launchpad.

		blocked: ${bBlocked}, // boolean
		busy: ${bBusy}, // boolean
		busyIndicatorDelay: ${1000}, // int
		busyIndicatorSize: ${sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium}, // sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize
		visible: ${bVisible}, // boolean
		fieldGroupIds: [${fieldGroupIds}], // string[]
		validateFieldGroup: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		text: ${""}, // string
		type: ${sap.m.ButtonType.Default}, // sap.m.ButtonType
		width: ${width}, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
		enabled: ${bEnabled}, // boolean
		icon: ${""}, // sap.ui.core.URI
		iconFirst: ${bIconFirst}, // boolean
		activeIcon: ${activeIcon}, // sap.ui.core.URI
		iconDensityAware: ${bIconDensityAware}, // boolean
		textDirection: ${sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit}, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
		ariaHasPopup: ${sap.ui.core.aria.HasPopup.None}, // sap.ui.core.aria.HasPopup
		accessibleRole: ${sap.m.ButtonAccessibleRole.Default}, // sap.m.ButtonAccessibleRole
		highlightAccKeysRef: ${bHighlightAccKeysRef}, // boolean
		accesskey: ${""}, // string
		badgeStyle: ${sap.m.BadgeStyle.Default}, // sap.m.BadgeStyle
		ariaDescribedBy: [${ariaDescribedBy}], // (sap.ui.core.Control|string)[]
		ariaLabelledBy: [${ariaLabelledBy}], // (sap.ui.core.Control|string)[]
		tap: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		press: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		actionType: ${"standard"}, // string
		press: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		afterRendering: [function (oEvent) {}, this] // function|array
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getActionType actionType} : string (default: "standard")
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterRendering afterRendering} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Button#constructor sap.m.Button} can be used as well.

Templates.helpDescription: Constructor for a new ui/launchpad/ActionItem.

Templates.constructorDescription:
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAccessibilityLabel accessibilityLabel} : string
    • {@link #getDisplayMode displayMode} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGroups groups} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:afterRendering afterRendering} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

Templates.constructorDescription:
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getUuid uuid} : string
    • {@link #getTileCatalogId tileCatalogId} : string
    • {@link #getTileCatalogIdStable tileCatalogIdStable} : string
    • {@link #getTarget target} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDebugInfo debugInfo} : string
    • {@link #getAnimationRendered animationRendered} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsLocked isLocked} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTileActionModeActive tileActionModeActive} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIeHtml5DnD ieHtml5DnD} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTileViews tileViews} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getFootItems footItems} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:coverDivPress coverDivPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterRendering afterRendering} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showActions showActions} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.ui.launchpad.LinkTileWrapper

Deprecated! Since 1.120 undefined
Constructor for a new ui/launchpad/LinkTileWrapper. A link tile to be displayed in the tile container. This control acts as container for specialized tile implementations.

Constructor for a new ui/launchpad/TileState. The tile state control that displays loading indicator, while tile view is loading and failed status in case tile view is not available.

Constructor for a new components/factsheet/controls/PictureTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties

    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "32px")
  • Associations

  • Events
    • {@link #event:pictureDelete pictureDelete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.CustomTile#constructor sap.m.CustomTile} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ushell.components.factsheet.controls.PictureTile
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 Please use {@link sap.m.Carousel} instead. PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Tile control embedding an image and allowing custom sizing

DeprecatedInfo.description:
Please use {@link sap.m.Carousel} instead.

PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.

Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new components/factsheet/controls/PictureViewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

  • Events

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.TileContainer#constructor sap.m.TileContainer} can be used as well.
